transcript.content: Placebo - Special Needs
Five past one then, already, on a Saturday, so I'm Ricky Gervais, that was Placebo, yeh, with "Special Needs" which brings me to my next point. With me, Karl Pilkington.
Karl Pilkington, there he is.
And Steve Merchant. 104.9
That's it.
We're back then.
Well, for one last time.

Well, it's certainly the end of the season. We're away for at least, you know, 2 months. We're doing the Office Special, um, and possibly forever depending on whether Karl decided he wants to carry on with this. Because, I mean, we do this for fun, we don't need to do this, we don't need to do this for, you know, um, money, obviously not.
The kind of money you're earning, Rick, you do not need to do this.
I don't think so. It's, quite honestly, beneath me.
Yeah.
You know. We don't need to do it to further our career because it's embarrassing being on Xfm.
You know people say, "Don't even bother cashing those Xfm cheques. It's not worth your while."
No, it's not, it's not. Yeah, the time it took to sign them, it wasn't, it wasn't worth it. Um, so, we do this basically ridicule Karl on a large sort of platform, I say, large platform.
Steve laughs
Yeah.
Xfm. Um, no other radio station will have us.
I mean, it's roughly the same as standing up in McDonald's
I'd imagine so. But, over lunchtime though.
Yeah, yeah, or when its just the cleaning staff wobbling around.
Ricky laughs
Yeah. So, er, and if Karl doesn't come back, he's breaking up the three-way partnership.
He's very much Sting, isn't he, in what, about 1986, '87.
Exactly.
He's gonna go off and, sort of, make some quite poor, sort of, jazz-inflected white man's soul leaving us to go about our business
Play pizza places and...
Steve laughs
Exactly. Yeah. Well I'm going to go in to, sort of,...
Say, "Dad, why can't I be in the CIA?"
Yeah.
"You don't know anything about it. You're a drummer."
Yeah.
Um, so, uh, we'll, we'll have to see, I mean, do you think anyone cares?
I wouldn't have thought so. Because, if someone was interesting in having some good chat and some great laughs, they'd spend more time with their friends
Yeah. Or listen to another radio station.
Or listen to a decent radio station.
Jonathan Ross or something like that, yeah.
I think they listen to Xfm for some music in the background that's loud enough...
Yeah.
So they can hear it while they're hoovering.
Yeah, I don't think our fans hoover.
Well, true, true.
I think you've got to have...
Or shoot up, whatever.
I think you've got to have a house to hoover. I'll tell you what they do want though. Some great music.
They do, indeed.
They'll be saying, "Since you've been gone...". See that, that's the sort of link I can do.
Oh, that's quite quality.
If we stayed together...
If you cut out all the other drivel you speak, you'd be great on Magic.
I know, yeah. Um, you've got...
Come on.
You've got, I know, you've got to rainbow something, haven't you?
Rainbow?
You've got to rainbow something!
Steve laughs
It's Rainbow.
Rainbow - Since You've Been Gone
